sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"中心"之意。
means: center ： 指三维空间的中心点，也可比喻抽象事物的中心。
middle ： 一般指时间、空间或过程两端间等距的部分。
heart ： 指事物最内部或最重要的部分，表地理位置时可与center换用。
core ： 指某事物固定的中心部分或最重要的核心部分。比喻意义指某物的精华。
midst ： 书面语用词，指在一个群体的深处或在某活动的进程中。

word_mean: 核，核心：任何物的中央部分，如疖中坏死物质的中央块
铁芯：周围绕线形成感应圈或电磁铁的铁棒
钻芯取样检验, core-drilling inspection
为获得铸件的内孔或复杂外形，用芯砂或其他材料制成的，组成型腔整体或局部的铸型组元。
线芯, 在编线或多股复捻线的中央部位，配置的若干根单纱、长丝或线填充物。
岩心, 取心钻头钻出的圆柱形岩矿样品。
纤芯, 在光纤中，大部分光功率由此通过的中心区。

encyclopedia.content: 中国开放教育资源协会（China Open Resources for Education 简称 CORE）成立于2003年10月，系非盈利机构，是一个以部分中国大学及全国省级广播电视大学为成员的联合体。 CORE是在中国走向信息化和教育国际化，国际教育资源共享运动潮流的推动下诞生的。2003年9月，IET基金会（International Engineering Technology Foundation简称IETF）、麻省理工学院（Massachusetts Institute of Technology简称MIT）和北京交通大学在北京共

entry.def: The core of a fruit is the central part of it. It contains seeds or pips.

example.ex: Peel the pears and remove the cores.

entry.tran: 去掉…的果心;给（水果）去核
entry.def: If you core a fruit, you remove its core.

entry.tran: (物体、建筑物或城市的)中心部分
entry.def: The core of an object, building, or city is the central part of it.

example.ex: The core of the city is a series of ancient squares.
example.tran: 市中心是一座接一座古老的广场。

entry.def: The core of something such as a problem or an issue is the part of it that has to be understood or accepted before the whole thing can be understood or dealt with.

example.ex: ...the ability to get straight to the core of a problem...
The notion that blacks comprise a problem is at the core of racist reasoning.
example.tran: 黑人总爱惹事这一观念是种族主义论断的核心。

entry.def: A core team or a core group is a group of people who do the main part of a job or piece of work. Other people may also help, but only for limited periods of time.

example.ex: We already have our core team in place...
example.tran: 我们的骨干团队已经就位了。

example.ex: A core of about six staff would continue with the project.
example.tran: 由大约6名职员组成的骨干队伍将继续该项目。

entry.def: In a school or college, core subjects are a group of subjects that have to be studied.

example.ex: The core subjects are English, mathematics and science...
example.tran: 基础课是英文、数学和科学。

example.ex: I'm not opposed to a core curriculum in principle, but I think requiring a foreign language is unrealistic.
example.tran: 原则上我不反对设置基础课程，但我认为要求掌握一门外语是不现实的。

entry.def: The core businesses or the core activities of a company or organization are their most important ones.

example.ex: The core activities of local authorities were reorganised...
example.tran: 地方政府的主要事务进行了调整。

example.ex: The group plans to concentrate on six core  businesses...
example.tran: 该集团打算主营6种业务。

entry.def: You can use to the core to describe someone who is a very strong supporter of someone or something and will never change their views. For example, you can say that someone is Republican to the core .

example.ex: The villagers are royalist to the core.
example.tran: 那些村民是十足的保皇主义者。

entry.def: If someone is shaken to the core or shocked to the core, they are extremely shaken or shocked.

example.ex: Leonard was shaken to the core; he'd never seen or read anything like it.
example.tran: 伦纳德极为震惊;他从未看过或读过这样的东西。

sentences.en: An apple core is the part of an apple left after the flesh has been eaten.
sentences.cn: 苹果核是在苹果肉吃完后剩下的部分。

means.word_mean: 核心, 精髓, 要点
